metadata.title: CVE-2020-35452 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
Apache HTTP Server versions 2.4.0 to 2.4.46 A specially crafted Digestnonce can cause a stack overflow in mod_auth_digest. There is no report ofthis overflow being exploitable, nor the Apache HTTP Server team couldcreate one, though some particular compiler and/or compilation option mightmake it possible, with limited consequences anyway due to the size (asingle byte) and the value (zero byte) of the overflow

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-35452` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
apache2-bin - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
apache2-data - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
apache2-mpm-event - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
apache2-mpm-itk - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
apache2-mpm-prefork - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
apache2-mpm-worker - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
apache2-suexec - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
apache2-utils - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
apache2.2-bin - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
libapache2-mod-macro - 1:2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
libapache2-mod-proxy-html - 1:2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: apache2 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1').
apache2 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1').
